content: DBS Multiplier Fresh Graduates DBS Savings Bank Account Investments General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 16 Oct 2018Urgent question: Do I need to hold off investing in POSB Invest-Saver until I open a DBS Multiplier account?Noticed that DBS Multiplier has this clause that states: Existing POSB Invest-Saver you purchased before opening DBS Multiplier will not be recognised. Does this mean that (1) I should avoid starting on POSB Invest-Saver at all, or (2) I can get started with investing in POSB Invest-Saver already. Just that the monthly ETF investments I made before opening my Multiplier account won't be recognised, but the ones made after will?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 17 Oct 2018Whatever products you invest in using the Invest-Saver, before opening the Multiplier account, will not be recognised. This means that you'll to use the Invest-saver to invest in a new product after opening the Multiplier account for it to be recognised for the next 12 months.0 comments0

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 16 Oct 2018Yes! You do need to wait till you open your DBS Multiplier!Don't make the mistake I did... once you are an existing investor via the POSB invest saver, there is no turning back..Now you can get to use this as a investing category.0 comments0
